data.q: What does the BEM (Block, Element, Modifier) naming convention aim to solve in CSS architecture?
o: Reducing the size of CSS files through compression
Creating a clear relationship between the HTML and CSS to improve maintainability
Automatically generating responsive breakpoints
Enabling CSS-in-JS functionality
data.e: BEM provides a modular structure that makes CSS more readable and predictable, reducing the risk of selector collisions in large projects.

data.q: In the BEM class name `button--large`, what does the double hyphen indicate?
o: The element inside the block
A child of the button
A modifier that changes the appearance or state of the block
A secondary block
data.e: In BEM, `__` (double underscore) denotes an Element, while `--` (double hyphen) denotes a Modifier.

data.q: What is the primary advantage of using CSS Variables (Custom Properties) over SASS variables?
o: They have a simpler syntax
They can be updated dynamically at runtime via JavaScript
They are supported in Internet Explorer 6
They can only store color values
data.e: CSS Variables are part of the DOM, meaning they can be changed in the browser (e.g., for a theme switcher) without recompiling the CSS.

o: A tool that checks for spelling errors in CSS
The set of rules browsers use to determine which CSS property values are the most relevant to an element
The speed at which CSS is rendered
The process of converting SASS into CSS
data.e: Specificity determines which styles are applied when multiple rules target the same element. IDs have higher specificity than classes, which have higher specificity than tags.

data.q: What do CSS 'Cascade Layers' (@layer) allow developers to control?
o: The z-index of elements on the page
The order of precedence of CSS rules, independent of specificity
The loading speed of external fonts
The transparency levels of nested divs
data.e: @layer allows you to group CSS into layers where the layer order determines priority, helping to manage style overrides more predictably.

data.q: In SASS/SCSS, what is a '@mixin' used for?
o: To perform mathematical calculations
To create reusable blocks of CSS code that can be included in other selectors
To define global constants
To import external JSON data
data.e: Mixins allow you to define a group of CSS declarations that you want to reuse throughout your site, often accepting arguments for flexibility.

data.q: Which CSS architecture philosophy promotes the use of single-purpose classes (e.g., `.m-0`, `.text-center`)?
o: OOCSS (Object Oriented CSS)
SMACSS (Scalable and Modular Architecture for CSS)
Utility-First / Atomic CSS
BEM
data.e: Utility-first/Atomic CSS (like Tailwind) uses small, single-responsibility classes to build components directly in the HTML.

data.q: What does the 'S' in SMACSS stand for?
o: Semantic
Scalable
Simplified
Systematic
data.e: SMACSS stands for Scalable and Modular Architecture for CSS, which categorizes CSS rules into Base, Layout, Module, State, and Theme.

data.q: What is the purpose of a PostCSS plugin like 'Autoprefixer'?
o: To minify the CSS code
To automatically add vendor prefixes (like -webkit- or -moz-) to CSS properties
To convert CSS into JavaScript
To validate the accessibility of colors
data.e: Autoprefixer uses data from 'Can I Use' to add necessary prefixes, ensuring cross-browser compatibility without manual effort.

data.q: In CSS, what happens to a rule marked with `!important`?
o: It is ignored by the browser
It overrides almost all other declarations, regardless of specificity
It only applies to mobile devices
It makes the text bold automatically
data.e: `!important` is a tool used to bypass the standard cascade and specificity, though it should be used sparingly as it makes debugging difficult.

o: Writing CSS styles inside JavaScript files, often scoped to a specific component
A way to run JavaScript inside a .css file
A legacy method of styling websites using <script> tags
A tool that converts CSS files into .js files
data.e: Popular in the React ecosystem (e.g., Styled Components), CSS-in-JS allows for scoped styling and dynamic styles based on component props.

data.q: What is 'Tree Shaking' in the context of CSS?
o: Organizing files into a folder tree
Removing unused CSS from the final bundle to reduce file size
Updating the DOM tree
Ensuring the CSS follows a hierarchical structure
data.e: Tree shaking (or Purging) analyzes your HTML/JS and 'shakes off' any CSS rules that aren't actually used in your project.
